summary: This document is an email chain from May 2017 regarding a request for quotes for a security camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The communication is between a DOJ communication technician and representatives from SigNet Technologies, a contractor.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: A sales representative for SigNet Technologies who handles quotes for system upgrades, as introduced in the email chain.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: A program manager at SigNet Technologies handling FBOP (Federal Bureau of Prisons) contracts, who forwarded the quote request to Steve Smith.

connections.description: Work together at SigNet Technologies, with Houston involving Smith to handle a quote request.
Smith is providing a quote for security camera equipment to the DOJ technician.

keyFacts: The document shows a 2017 request for security camera system upgrade quotes for the MCC-New York federal prison.
SigNet Technologies, a contractor, was involved in providing pricing for the upgrade through its employees Steve Smith and Justin Houston.
The email chain indicates ongoing procurement or maintenance activities at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was later held.
